profile_positions.description:
In my role as a senior scientist in the department Sustainable Process & Energy Systems of TNO, I work on the design, development and evaluation of novel processes for application in industries producing chemicals, energy, food, pharmaceuticals and materials. 

As an expert in the field of separation technologies  I focus on multi-phase processes with special interest in solids handling e.g. crystallization. 

In this role I apply my knowledge on process technology on:
- Process System Design & Development for product recovery:  selection and evaluation of separation technologies, particularly applied to biomass conversion and electro-organic synthesis. 
- Integration of Process and Energy technologies for storage & conversion of heat.
- Wide application  of my expertise on crystallization process technology in various domains.

In this role I am responsible for:
- Generation of process concepts to match industry problems with technology solutions resulting in projects that are funded or B2B. . 
- Technical definition of  projects and supervision over the technical quality during execution. In this phase I work closely in project teams with project leaders, scientists and technicians. 
- Reporting experimental results  to customers, peers and management.
- Creating exposure of our activities by giving lectures at conferences and by writing articles in scientific and industrial journals.
- Scouting opportunities for our department to start new projects in national and European research programs (EU SPIRE).
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist Process Technology

profile_positions.description:
As part of my role as research scientist at TNO I had a temporary appointment as associate researcher In the group Intensified Reactions and Separations headed by professor Andzrej Stankiewicz. The objective of this assignment was:
- to build collaboration between the two departments, 
- to track novel scientific developments that may become of interest to TNO,
- to scout for potential new junior colleagues for our team.
I did so  by writing and submitting proposals for research on novel process concepts and on novel methods to test these concepts. Additionally, I took part in scientific and educational activities of the IRS team, for example by giving lectures in the course on Process Technology for Mechanical Engineering students. The collaboration with this group was suspended because the interests of both parties shifted over time to other fields.
profile_positions.title: Associate Researcher

profile_positions.description:
At the Laboratory for Process Equipment, in the group Separation Technology I carried out my Ph-research project for my promotor prof dr ir Peter Jansens. The title of my dissertation is: Polymorphism in Precipitation. The subject concerns a study on control over the formation of polymorphic compounds in continuous crystallization. My assignment included the following activities: 
- I was responsible for the design and construction of a dedicated continuous flow set-up,
- I carried out and supervised students carrying out crystallization experiments,
- I am still proud on my discovery of a metastable liquid-liquid phase split preceding crystallization of the stable crystal form, the project resulted in six publications in peer-reviewed journals,
- as part of my assignment I supervised six BSc and MSc students, both Dutch and international, 
- I co-organized a workshop (BIWIC8) for over 100 participants and I edited the proceedings.
In this job I learned how academical research is performed.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
My first job was at the Process Technology Department of chemical company Akzo Nobel. In my role as junior researcher I had a support role for the business units active in the production of salt, soda ash and soap ingredients. In this role I worked on research projects in an internally funded research organization (service unit) with senior and junior scientists and technicians. Part of the activities I carried out on-site at the production facilities, working closely with plant engineers and plant operators.  
In this job I learned how the chemical industry works both business wise and technically, especially how production processes are continuously improved in order to improve benefits and to lower costs.
